did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.physdesc: Field journals; reports; lecture notes; data; films, photographs, and photograph albums; correspondence; financial records; maps; printed materials; bird guides; and audiotapes.
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: More than 70 motion picture films, photographic and written materials regarding ornithological trips taken by Lawrence Grinnell from 1938 to 1971; correspondence and a pamphlet, "The 1957-1958 New Zealand-Australia Expedition of the Laboratory of Ornithology"; materials pertaining to his dissertation A Study of the Common Redpoll, a notebook of Cornell ornithology seminars and Canoeable Waterways of New York State and Vicinity written by Grinnell.

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: Lawrence I. Grinnell was an ornithologist. He earned an M.S. in 1943 and a Ph.D. in 1947, both from Cornell University.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Field journals; reports; lecture notes; data; films, photographs, an audiotape, and photograph albums; correspondence; financial records; maps; printed materials; and bird guides regarding ornithological trips taken by Lawrence Grinnell from 1938 to 1971: St. Lawrence Gulf, Churchill (Manitoba), Alaska, Southern and Western United States, Trinidad, Guatemala, Colombia, Mexico, West Indies, Tobago, British Guiana, Panama, Africa, New Zealand, Australia, the Amazon region, Brazil, Venezuela, Peru, the Antarctic, India, and Nepal; also, correspondence and a pamphlet, "The 1957-1958 New Zealand-Australia Expedition of the Laboratory of Ornithology"; materials pertaining to his dissertation A Study of the Common Redpoll a notebook of Cornell ornithology seminars and Canoeable Waterways of New York State and Vicinity.

controlaccess.head: Names:
controlaccess.persname: Grinnell, Lawrence I. (Lawrence Irving), 1889-1985. New Zealand-Australia expedition of the Laboratory of Ornithology, 1957-1958.
Grinnell, Lawrence I. (Lawrence Irving), 1889-1985. Study of the common redpoll.
Grinnell, Lawrence I. (Lawrence Irving),1889-1895. Canoeable Waterways of New York State and Vicinity.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Lawrence I. Grinnell Papers, #2649. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

relatedmaterial.head: RELATED MATERIAL
relatedmaterial.p: Lawrence I. Grinnell, "A Century of Unitarian History in Ithaca, 1865-1965." Pamphlet, #1525.
Correspondence and other material related to Lawrence Grinnell appears in the Arthur Augustus Allen papers, #21-18-1255 with whom he worked at the Laboratory of Ornithology.

arrangement.head: SERIES LIST
arrangement.p:
Series I. Field Journals of Ornithological Trips
Box 1 & 3

Series II. Expedition Materials, Lecture and Film Notes
Boxes 2 & 4

Series III. Research, Manuscripts and Printed Materials by and about Grinnell
Boxes 2 & 4

Series V. Motion Picture Films
Boxes 5-8
